道化芝居: (どうけしばい) - (yoji) farce; low comedy
道半ば: (みちなかば) - midway; halfway through; in the course of
道均し: (みちならし) - road leveling; road levelling
道場: (どうじょう) - dojo (hall used for martial arts training); manda (place of Buddhist practice or meditation, esp. the place under the bodhi tree where Buddha attained enlightenment)
道場破り: (どうじょうやぶり) - challenge another training group and defeat each member
道士: (どうし) - a person of high morals; a Taoist
道学: (どうがく) - ethics/moral philosophy; (the study of) Confucianism (esp. neo-Confucianism); (the study of) Taoism; Edo-period popularized blend of Buddhist, Shinto and Confucian ethical teachings (popularised)
道導: (みちしるべ) - guidepost/signpost; guide/manual/handbook; tiger beetle (esp. the Japanese tiger beetle, Cicindela japonica)
道州制: (どうしゅうせい) - administrative reform proposal, involving integration of prefectures into 7 or 9 states
道師: (みちのし) - Michinoshi (fifth highest of the eight hereditary titles)
道幅: (みちはば) - width of a road
道府県: (どうふけん) - Hokkai-do, Osaka-fu, Kyoto-fu and remaining prefectures (all administrative divisions of Japan except Tokyo-to)
道形に: (みちなりに) - along the road (e.g. following its curves without turning off at any intersection); along the street
道徳上: (どうとくじょう) - morally; from the moral point of view
道徳再武装: (どうとくさいぶそう) - Moral Rearmament; MRA
道徳哲学: (どうとくてつがく) - moral philosophy
道徳堅固: (どうとくけんご) - (yoji) of strict morals (moral principles); highly moral
道徳感覚: (どうとくかんかく) - moral sense; sense of morality
道徳教育: (どうとくきょういく) - moral education
道徳法則: (どうとくほうそく) - moral law
道徳的危険: (どうとくてききけん) - moral hazard
道徳的空白: (どうとくてきくうはく) - moral vacuum
道徳的証明: (どうとくてきしょうめい) - argument from morality (for the existence of God)
道徳観念: (どうとくかんねん) - sense of morality; moral sense
道徳退廃: (どうとくたいはい) - (yoji) moral decadence (decline, corruption)
道心堅固: (どうしんけんご) - (yoji) being of firm (unshakable) faith and strict practice
道念: (どうねん) - moral sense; wife of a monk
道教: (みちおしえ) - tiger beetle (esp. the Japanese tiger beetle, Cicindela japonica)
道教え: (みちおしえ) - tiger beetle (esp. the Japanese tiger beetle, Cicindela japonica)
道明寺粉: (どうみょうじこ) - coarse rice powder
道板: (みちいた) - removable ramps for trucks
道案内: (みちあんない) - guidepost; guidance; guide; street map
道楽: (みちがく) - form of gagaku performed while marching
道楽仕事: (どうらくしごと) - (yoji) work done for enjoyment (as a diversion); dilettante work
道楽仲間: (どうらくなかま) - (yoji) companion in one's pleasures; companion in hobby activities
道楽娘: (どうらくむすめ) - prodigal daughter; daughter of loose morals
道楽息子: (どうらくむすこ) - (yoji) prodigal son; wastrel son; son of loose morals
道沿い: (みちぞい) - along the road; at the side of the road
道理で: (どうりで) - indeed; it's no wonder
道理にかなう: (どうりにかなう) - to stand to reason
道理に外れた: (どうりにはずれた) - contrary to reason
道理に適う: (どうりにかなう) - to stand to reason
道理至極: (どうりしごく) - (yoji) very reasonable; being perfectly consistent with reason; standing to reason
道産娘: (どさんこ) - horse native to Hokkaido; person born and raised in Hokkaido
道産子: (どさんこ) - horse native to Hokkaido; person born and raised in Hokkaido
道着: (どうぎ) - uniform worn in martial arts (judo, kendo, etc.)
道立高等学校: (どうりつこうとうがっこう) - prefectural senior high school (in Hokkaido); public senior high school (in Hokkaido)
道筋をつける: (みちすじをつける) - to pave the way; to put in motion; to put on the road (to)
道筋を付ける: (みちすじをつける) - to pave the way; to put in motion; to put on the road (to)
道管: (どうかん) - (esp. 導管) conduit/pipe/duct; {bot} (esp. 道管) vessel
道義的責任: (どうぎてきせきにん) - moral obligation
道聴塗説: (どうちょうとせつ) - (yoji) shallow-minded mouthing of secondhand information
道芝: (みちしば) - roadside grass/roadside weeds; guidance (sometimes esp. referring to guidance in love)/guidepost/guide; Chinese fountain grass (Pennisetum alopecuroides)
道草: (みちくさ) - loitering on the way; wayside grass
道草をくう: (みちくさをくう) - to loiter (on the way); to waste time
道草を食う: (みちくさをくう) - to loiter (on the way); to waste time
道蔵: (どうぞう) - Dao Zang; Taoist canon
道行: (みちゆき) - going down the road/travelling/traveling; lyric composition describing scenery a traveler sees on the way (traveller); eloping
道行き: (みちゆき) - going down the road/travelling/traveling; lyric composition describing scenery a traveler sees on the way (traveller); eloping
道行く: (みちゆく) - to walk down the road
道諦: (どうたい) - truth of the way to the cessation of suffering
道議: (どうぎ) - member of the Hokkaido Prefectural Assembly
道議会議員: (どうぎかいぎいん) - member of the Hokkaido Prefectural Assembly
